net_reaction() → Dict[str, float][source]¶

Returns the net reaction (or pseudo-reaction) of the pathway, i.e. the stoichiometric sum of all reactions of the pathway. See Reaction::sum_stoichio for more details.

pseudo_reaction() → chemlite.Reaction.Reaction[source]¶

Same as net_reaction()

Rename a compound within the pathway. Actually, the compound is renamed over all reactions

Parameters

  • new_id (str) – ID that the compound has to be renamed to

  • stoichio (int) – Stoichiometric coefficient to set the product compound to

  • stoichio (int) – Stoichiometric coefficient to set the reactant compound to

Set the reactants of the reaction

Parameters

compounds (Dict[str, int]) – Stoichiometric dictionary to set the reactions’s reactants to

static sum_stoichio(reactions: List[chemlite.Reaction.Reaction]) → Dict[str, int][source]¶

Make the sum of stoichiometric coefficients of all species in all reactions in the passed list and returns a stoichiometric dictionary of the pseudo-reaction. If a compound is both a reactant of a reaction of the list (coeff < 0) and a product of another reaction of the list (coeff > 0), the sum could be 0 and the compound is naturally deleted from the result (pseudo-reaction).

Parameters

reactions (List['Reaction']) – List of reactions to make the stoichiometric sum of

Returns

stoichio – Stoichiometric dictionary of summed stoichiometric coefficients (pseudo-reaction)

Return type

Dict[str, int]

to_string() → str[source]¶

string – String representation of the reaction

Return type
